intro: Arctium sakawense, commonly known as the Sakawa burweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and thistles. The plant is characterized by its spiny, globe-shaped fruits that contain seeds, typical of the genus Arctium. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
